New Records: Comoros secured a crucial 1-0 victory in their 2026 World Cup Qualifying match against Ghana, marking a significant milestone in their qualifying campaign.
Key Match Events: Myziane Maolida scored Comoros' first goal in the 43rd minute, giving his team the lead.
Ghana made a substitution in the 88th minute, bringing on Jonathan Sowah for Iddrisu Baba.
Pre-Game Insights: Comoros and Ghana faced off in a crucial match at Stade de Moroni, with Comoros aiming to continue their strong qualifying campaign.
Both teams fielded strong lineups, with Comoros starting with a 4-3-3 formation and Ghana optinging for a 4-3-3 as well.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in front of 11,628 fans at Stade de Moroni, showcasing strong local support for Comoros.
The game also held significance as part of the broader 2026 World Cup Qualifying - CAF, Group Stage, emphasizing its importance in the regional qualifying process.
Others: The match marked Comoros' progress in their World Cup qualifying journey, highlighting their growing presence on the international stage.
